channel.title: CyberNetSec - Latest Cybersecurity Articles
channel.description: Latest cybersecurity threat intelligence articles from the past 3 days

item.title: Critical Adobe Commerce Flaw Under Active Exploitation, CISA Warns
item.description:
A critical improper input validation vulnerability in Adobe Commerce and Magento, tracked as CVE-2025-54236, is being actively exploited in the wild. Dubbed 'SessionReaper,' the flaw allows an unauthenticated remote attacker to hijack user sessions via the REST API, leading to potential web shell de...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cyberattack, Data Breach

Read Full Article →

item.title: ChatGPT Flaw Allows 'Memory Poisoning' via CSRF Attack
item.description:
A novel vulnerability discovered in OpenAI's ChatGPT Atlas web browser allows attackers to perform 'memory poisoning' through a Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) attack. Researchers at LayerX Security found that this flaw can be used to invisibly inject malicious instructions into ChatGPT's persiste...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Vulnerability, Cloud Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: APT-C-60 Escalates 'SpyGlace' Campaign Against Japan
item.description:
The South Korea-aligned cyber-espionage group APT-C-60 has significantly intensified its campaign against Japanese organizations in the third quarter of 2025. According to JPCERT/CC and Cyble, the group has deployed at least three new versions of its custom 'SpyGlace' backdoor. The attackers have ev...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Malware

Read Full Article →

item.title: Data Breaches Hit Toys 'R' Us Canada, Askul, and Verisure
item.description:
A wave of data breaches has impacted several consumer-facing companies globally. Toys "R" Us Canada has had customer records leaked on the dark web. Japanese retailer Askul suffered a disruptive ransomware attack that halted operations and may have resulted in a data leak. Additionally, Swedish secu...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Ransomware

Read Full Article →

item.title: Healthcare Sector Rocked by Breaches at ModMed, LifeBridge, and Right at Home
item.description:
The healthcare sector continues to be a prime target for cyberattacks, with recent data breaches announced by Electronic Health Record (EHR) provider Modernizing Medicine (ModMed), home healthcare provider Right at Home, and Baltimore-based LifeBridge Health. The incidents, which include a ransomwar...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Ransomware, Regulatory

Read Full Article →

item.title: DDoS Attack on Russian Food Agency Cripples National Supply Chains
item.description:
Russia's federal agency for veterinary and phytosanitary surveillance, Rosselkhoznadzor, has been targeted by a large-scale distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attack starting October 22, 2025. The attack crippled the agency's critical electronic certification systems, including the 'Mercury' platf...

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Industrial Control Systems, Policy and Compliance

Read Full Article →

item.title: Safepay Ransomware Hits German Surveillance Firm Xortec, Sparking Supply Chain Fears
item.description:
The Safepay ransomware group has claimed responsibility for a cyberattack against Xortec GmbH, a German provider of professional video surveillance solutions. The group has listed Xortec on its data leak site with a payment deadline of October 27, 2025. This attack raises significant supply chain co...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Supply Chain Attack, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: Google Issues Emergency Patch for Critical Chrome RCE Flaw Found by AI
item.description:
Google has released an emergency security update for the Chrome browser, addressing a critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability in its V8 JavaScript engine. The flaw, tracked as CVE-2025-12036, was discovered by Google's internal AI-driven research project, 'Big Sleep.' Successful exploitat...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management

Read Full Article →

item.title: Nation-State and Financial Cybercrime Blur as Industrial Sector Becomes Top Target
item.description:
A new report from Trellix reveals a significant convergence between the tactics of nation-state actors and financially motivated cybercriminals, with both increasingly leveraging AI-powered tools. The industrial sector has emerged as the most targeted industry, accounting for over 36% of attacks ana...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Threat Actor, Industrial Control Systems

Read Full Article →

item.title: India Enacts New Telecom Cybersecurity Rules for IMEI and Mobile Number Validation
item.description:
India's Ministry of Communications has enacted new cybersecurity regulations for its telecommunications sector, effective October 22, 2025. The 'Telecommunications (Telecom Cyber Security) Amendment Rules, 2025' introduce two key measures: the establishment of a centralized Mobile Number Validation ...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Regulatory, Policy and Compliance, Mobile Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: UN Convention Against Cybercrime Signed in Hanoi Amid Global Endorsement and Controversy
item.description:
In a landmark event in Hanoi, Vietnam, representatives from nearly 100 UN member states have signed the United Nations Convention against Cybercrime. Adopted by the UN General Assembly in December 2024, this treaty, also known as the Hanoi Convention, establishes the first global legal framework for...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory

Read Full Article →

item.title: EU Accuses Meta and TikTok of Breaching Digital Services Act Transparency Rules
item.description:
The European Commission has issued preliminary findings that Meta's platforms (Facebook and Instagram) and TikTok have breached their obligations under the Digital Services Act (DSA). The Commission alleges the companies failed to provide adequate access to public data for researchers, hindering ind...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Regulatory, Policy and Compliance

Read Full Article →

item.title: Google Patches 6th Actively Exploited Chrome Zero-Day of 2025
item.description:
Google has issued an emergency security update for its Chrome web browser to address CVE-2025-10585, a high-severity type confusion vulnerability in the V8 JavaScript engine. This marks the sixth time in 2025 that Google has patched a Chrome zero-day vulnerability that was being actively exploited i...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management

Read Full Article →

item.title: Agenda Ransomware Evolves, Hits Critical Infrastructure
item.description:
The Agenda ransomware group, also known as Qilin, is escalating its attacks by targeting critical infrastructure sectors with evolved tactics. According to research from Trend Micro, the ransomware-as-a-service (RaaS) operation is using a cross-platform approach, abusing legitimate remote management...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Industrial Control Systems

Read Full Article →

item.title: Tengu Ransomware Hits Brazilian Education Provider
item.description:
The Tengu ransomware group has claimed responsibility for a cyberattack against UniCursos, a prominent education provider in Brazil. The attack, which was posted to the group's leak site on October 23, 2025, follows the common double-extortion model, where the attackers threaten to publish sensitive...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Ransomware Hits Jewett-Cameron, Steals Financial Data
item.description:
Jewett-Cameron, an Oregon-based manufacturing and distribution company, has confirmed in an SEC filing that it suffered a ransomware attack on October 15, 2025. The attack caused significant disruption to its business operations and resulted in the theft of sensitive corporate data. The exfiltrated ...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Lawsuit Hits SC School District After Ransomware Breach
item.description:
South Carolina's Lexington-Richland School District 5 (LR5) is facing a class-action lawsuit following a ransomware attack in June 2025 that exposed the personally identifiable information (PII) of over 31,000 students, staff, and alumni. The lawsuit alleges that the school district was negligent in...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Data Breach, Ransomware, Regulatory

Read Full Article →

item.title: Lazarus Group's 'Operation DreamJob' Targets EU Drone-Makers
item.description:
The notorious North Korea-linked APT group, Lazarus, is conducting a cyber-espionage campaign dubbed 'Operation DreamJob' targeting European defense and aerospace companies. The campaign specifically focuses on firms involved in Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV) technology. The attackers use sophisticat...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Phishing
